edu.vt.cbil.visda.comp
Class FeaturePreSelector

java.lang.Object
  edu.vt.cbil.visda.comp.FeaturePreSelector

public class FeaturePreSelector
extends java.lang.Object

The class performs a feature pre-selection to reduce the dimensionality

Version:
visda_v0.1
Author:
Jiajing Wang

Field Summary

          the type of clustering '0' - phenotype clustering; '1' - gene clustering

(package private)  double[][] featureMean
          the means of selected genes with its average over each class
(package private)  double[][] featureVar
          the variance of selected genes with its average over each class

          the number of original gene features

          the number of selected features

          the labels for samples, each indicates that which class this sample belongs to

          the selected data matrix after feature selection
(package private)  int[] selectedFeatureIndex
          the selected feature index
(package private)  double[] sortedPerformanceIndex
          the sorted SNR values with descending order

 void print()
          This method prints the selected features and labels
 void snrSupervised()
          This method performs supervised feature selection by using signal-to-noise ratio (SNR), and the features with larger SNR values will be selected.

          This Native (C++) function calculates the signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) performance for each dimension individually, and sorted the SNR values by descending order.

Constructor Detail

FeaturePreSelector

public FeaturePreSelector(int clusterType,
                          double[][] data,
                          int genesNum,
                          int samplesNum,
                          int featuresNum,
                          int[] labels)
Create a FeaturePreSelector instance

Parameters:
clusterType - the type of clustering: '0' - phenotype clustering; '1' - gene clustering
data - the matrix data is stored in two-dimension array
genesNum - the number of genes
samplesNum - the number of samples
featuresNum - the number of features
labels - the label for each sample indicates that which class this sample belongs to
Method Detail

veSNR

public int veSNR(int m,
                 int n,
                 double[] data,
                 int[] label,
                 int dim_num,
                 int[] top_label,
                 double[] snr_sorted,
                 int class_num,
                 double[] mean,
                 double[] var)
This Native (C++) function calculates the signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) performance for each dimension individually, and sorted the SNR values by descending order.

Parameters:
m - the number of rows of matrix data
n - the number of columns of matrix data
data - the matrix data is stored in one-dimension array with row major order
label - the label for each sample indicates that which class this sample belongs to
dim_num - the number of selected features
top_label - the indexs of selected features in original order
snr_sorted - the sorted SNR values in descending order
Returns:
'1'- successfully exit; '0'- exit with waring/error

snrSupervised

public void snrSupervised()
This method performs supervised feature selection by using signal-to-noise ratio (SNR), and the features with larger SNR values will be selected.

print

public void print()
This method prints the selected features and labels
